title: Muscle Car Suspension Upgrade on a Pontiac LeMans! - Hot Rod Garage Ep. 6

comments.text: Awesome wheels/suspension, but it sounds like shit.﻿
comments.author: solofalcon

comments.text:
I'm sure it's much better than manual steering, but I think that's the 
first time I've ever heard the standard 14.4:1 steering box referred to as 
"quick." A quick ratio box is 12.7:1, and honestly, 14.4:1 seems slow as 
hell to me... I guess it's better than a 22:1 manual box, but it's far from 
quick.﻿
comments.author: James Johnson

comments.text:
I'm a big roadkill fan.I wish you guys could come help me with my 2002 
Toyota 4runner. Check engine light is on.Throttle position switch, shift 
solenoid, and several other codes.The truck runs rough. And I drive it 
daily. It's never left me stranded on the side of the road."knock on 
wood".I've taken it to the best mechanic in my area, he done a smoke test, 
found three vacuum leaks. He fixed them but cannot figure out the rest. The 
only other option is the dealership. But that's not going to happen. I will 
fix it myself before I pay thousands of dollars to those crooks.Can someone 
please give me some professional advice.I wish Scotty Kilmer lived around 
the corner. LOL.﻿
comments.author: Brian Easy

comments.text: BAM!!﻿
comments.author: kalboski90

comments.text:
My mom had to replace her rear springs on her 87 ponac bonnivle before its 
breaks locked up at a stoplight and broke its headlights the guy was nice 
and didn't do annything﻿
comments.author: Jason Aaron

comments.text:
The reason the views are low for the rancho is exactly the reason stated. 
The thumb nails are very similar. I eventually found out that those were 
episodes I never seen and spent a good 2 hrs watching them. Very good ep's 
and I wish I didnt skip them becuase I caught up on some great stuff I 
missed.﻿
comments.author: 0726cobrasrule

comments.text:
How did you run the brake lines to the master cylinder, or did you make new 
lines?﻿
Can I have the "citrus juicers"? Need a set for my 65 Fury.﻿

comments.text: Haha Finnigan shot down for a high five﻿
comments.author: Chris Scully

comments.text: I love the alasca trips :)﻿
comments.author: Leif djurfeldt

comments.text: Now i wanna see this car with a decent engine and gearbox in it!﻿

comments.text:
Im having a terrible time getting better suspension for my 64 Catalina. Ive 
had 3 different companies, one of which is C.P.P., flake out on me. No one 
has parts. HELP ME SOMEONE!!!﻿

comments.text:
the Hi-5's at the end was pretty funny.. Thanks for somewhat fixing the 
special needs person's car.﻿

comments.author: Powerglide350

comments.text: I love Pontiacs! Wish more of the 70's stuff though!﻿
comments.author: Karck

comments.text:
Edelbrock is not good for cornering, but i had same problem as this car. 
Changed bigger better flowing needle seats helped.
comments.author: Karck

comments.text: I loved the alaska ronchero episodes I have watched them a couple of times.﻿
comments.author: chevyy steve

comments.text: wow Finnegan was channeling his inner Elwood Blues there﻿

comments.text: I love the Alaska videos﻿

comments.text:

drop it on me.﻿

comments.text:
what are the american racing wheels that they put on the pontiac at the end 
???﻿
comments.author: sam dennis

comments.text:
Tech tip: I learned recently, to keep a battery alive for it's full 
lifetime, it needs to be fully charged at least once every 10 days. Perhaps 
a solar charger for those cars which sit outside.... Hmm.. I have who 
vehicles sitting that I don't do that to.﻿
comments.author: researcher4good

comments.text: i liked the juicer rims better﻿
comments.author: arielatom03

comments.text:
OK, who's the embarrassed Pontiac Lemans owner who degreased his oil pan 
half way through this episode, so the bottom of his engine no longer 
had two quarts worth of sludge hanging off it by the time the shiny new 
parts where installed? LOL!

Great video guys!﻿
comments.author: Red Rider7

comments.text: 24:57 dat subtitlez :D﻿
comments.author: 3roK

comments.text: Just saying' Alaska trip was pretty epic. Watched all the parts.﻿
comments.author: Rob Lucchetti

comments.text:
did u guys skip the alignment step?  It looks like the front chamber is 
vertical . can that be changed to give the tire a better footing in the 
turns. seems the body still rolled quite a bit.﻿
comments.author: wan2bvader

comments.text:
I'm looking at the way Finnegan is holding that big truck battery at 5:40. 
 I swear it's a dummy plastic box.  It's rolling side to side on his 
fingertips like it weighs nothing.﻿
comments.author: CosmoxYRik

comments.text: The Alaska trip is awesome. I love all the episodes tho!!!!﻿
comments.author: Ranjeet Sigh

comments.text:
And I liked the Alaska episodes. I think Mike is right. At first glance 
they all look like the same episode.﻿
comments.author: Jay Bob

comments.text:
This is great. Entertaining as hell. Love the final words of the Turbo 
explanation ... Keep this series going, solid work guys.﻿
comments.author: Jay Bob

comments.text: George's Honda turbo quip nearly showered my monitor with soda xD﻿

comments.text: cool﻿
comments.author: Justin Tackett

comments.text:
Nuther great episode!! Reminds me. Is there something to be addressed about 
the Edlebrock carb stalling on turns and heavy braking or was it the brake 
master booster combo, or a combo of both? Thanx!! JimmyCC﻿

comments.text:
I have a great looking motor with a crappy looking master and booster.
